titlestmt.titleproper: BU Records: Summer School, Inclusive: 1926-1949, Bulk: 1927

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Records Summary
did.abstract: BU Records: Summer School collection contains a variety of materials relating to Baylor University’s Summer School program during the years of 1926-1949.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Baylor University Summer School was a program offered by Baylor University beginning in 1889-1890. The program was established in order to serve those seeking to earn college credit outside of the normal academic year. This includes Baylor students themselves, high school students looking to earn credits for college, and teachers who were completing their teaching certifications. The school offered a variety of courses including those in education, speech, theater, music, business, and law. Baylor continues to offer summer courses to this day.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: BU Records: Summer School collection consists of materials from 1926-1949, with some undated items. These materials reflect the activities of the Summer School and its dean, T.D. Brooks.

There are two series in this collection. Series I. Administrative Files contains materials such as advertisements for the Summer School and potential lecturers, bulletins for the school, and class schedules and enrollment lists. Series II. Correspondence contains letters requesting information for program and letters between the dean and students.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to processing, this collection was housed in one document box. Most of the correspondence was contained within undated folders organized alphabetically, while the remaining materials were in unorganized stacks. For the current round of processing, materials of the same topic were grouped together.

Currently, this collection contains two series, I. Administrative Files and II. Correspondence. Series I. Administrative Files are organized according to topic while Series II. Correspondence are organized alphabetically.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: BU Records: Summer School, Accession #BU/166, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Jackson Hager. Released on 2019-10-21.

relatedmaterial.head: Related references
relatedmaterial.bibref: BU Records: Summer School Records, Accession #BU/166, Box 1, Folder 2, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains the advertisements, bulletins, and school records for the Baylor University Summer School. The condition of the series is good.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains correspondence from T.D. Brooks, the dean of the Summer School, to those outside of the university. The condition of the series is good.
